titlestmt.titleproper: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Office of Communications and Membership records 1978-1995
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Office of Communications and Membership records

bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials from the Public Affairs department and the Office of Communications and Membership of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. Some of the records are from the office of Dale Ross, Director of Communications, 1992-1995. Materials include correspondence, memoranda, invitations and brochures, lists of program attendees, membership lists, photographs, files on lectures and programs, subject files on outside organizations, and photographs, contact sheets, and negatives of visitors, exhibits, and programs. Programs and events documented through planning materials, correspondence, and photographs include Operation Smile, the bicentennial of the College of Physicians, and the visits of C. Everett Koop and Ronald Reagan to the College of Physicians. In addition, there are 11 videos of the Reagan visit. The collection also includes a small amount of information related to the College's Continuing Medical Education (CME) programs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
